title: Letter: Only central banks can take on card companies
text:
Patrick Jenkins (“Legacy payment groups avoid a Kodak moment, but threats loom”, Opinion, November 22) is correct that legacy payment groups such as Visa and Mastercard are ripe for disruption but he is looking in the wrong direction.

Venture-backed fintechs don't have the necessary scale or digital trust needed to disturb the incumbents. Central banks do.

According to the Bank for International Settlements, nine out of 10 are exploring central bank digital currencies with more than half developing them or running concrete experiments.

Brazil's instant payment system, Pix, launched by its central bank in November 2020, now processes around 2.5bn transactions a day and is rapidly eating into the volume of the credit card networks.

These innovations will be the real game changers in the payments industry.

Jonathan Hakim
Belmont, MA, US
